abstract: Obama administration announces that people who want to buy health insurance in federal marketplace following closure of open enrollment period will be required to show documents verifying their eligibility; requirement responds to insurer concerns that people enrolling after deadline tend to generate more claims and raise premiums.
lead_paragraph: A new policy requires people to submit documents like a birth or marriage certificate if they want to use special enrollment periods to sign up for coverage after the open enrollment deadline.

headline.main: Proof Needed to Enroll in Health Plan Post-Deadline
headline.print_headline: Proof Needed to Enroll in Health Plan Post-Deadline

snippet: A new policy requires people to submit documents like a birth or marriage certificate if they want to use special enrollment periods to sign up for coverage after the open enrollment deadline.
